The user wants me to check tasks.md and report the number of incomplete tasks. If all are complete, output 'ALL_COMPLETE', otherwise 'REMAINING: N'.

Let me read the tasks.md file.

1â†’# Tasks: Fixed-Point Verification (Phase 13B)
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/040-fixed-point-verification/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: Included per Constitution Principle VII (TDD required)
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks grouped by user story for independent implementation and testing
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1, US2, US3, US4, US5)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’---
    17â†’
    18â†’## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)
    19â†’
    20â†’**Purpose**: Project initialization and prerequisite verification
    21â†’
    22â†’- [ ] T001 Verify Stage 1 binary exists at dist/clysm-stage1.wasm
    23â†’- [ ] T002 Verify wasmtime runtime is available (wasmtime --version)
    24â†’- [ ] T003 [P] Verify wasm-tools is available (wasm-tools --version)
    25â†’- [ ] T004 [P] Verify Node.js is available for host shims (node --version)
    26â†’- [ ] T005 Create tests/unit/fixpoint/ directory structure
    27â†’- [ ] T006 [P] Create tests/contract/ fixpoint test placeholder
    28â†’- [ ] T007 [P] Create tests/integration/ fixpoint test placeholder
    29â†’
    30â†’---
    31â†’
    32â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    33â†’
    34â†’**Purpose**: Core data structures and package definitions that ALL user stories depend on
    35â†’
    36â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    37â†’
    38â†’- [ ] T008 Extend src/clysm/stage1/types.lisp with verification-result struct
    39â†’- [ ] T009 [P] Extend src/clysm/stage1/types.lisp with byte-diff-info struct
    40â†’- [ ] T010 [P] Extend src/clysm/stage1/types.lisp with verification-history-entry struct
    41â†’- [ ] T011 Extend src/clysm/stage1/conditions.lisp with fixpoint-error condition hierarchy
    42â†’- [ ] T012 Create src/clysm/stage2/package.lisp with clysm/stage2 package definition
    43â†’- [ ] T013 Export new symbols from src/clysm/stage1/package.lisp
    44â†’
    45â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    46â†’
    47â†’---
    48â†’
    49â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Stage 2 Generation (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    50â†’
    51â†’**Goal**: Run Stage 1 Wasm binary on wasmtime to compile Clysm source and produce Stage 2 binary
    52â†’
    53â†’**Independent Test**: Execute `./scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh` and verify `dist/clysm-stage2.wasm` is created and valid
    54â†’
    55â†’### Tests for User Story 1
    56â†’
    57â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    58â†’
    59â†’- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Unit test for wasmtime invocation in tests/unit/fixpoint/runner-test.lisp
    60â†’- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Unit test for Stage 2 generation in tests/unit/fixpoint/stage2-gen-test.lisp
    61â†’- [ ] T016 [P] [US1] Contract test for Stage 2 binary validity in tests/contract/fixpoint-stage2-test.lisp
    62â†’
    63â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    64â†’
    65â†’- [ ] T017 [US1] Implement run-form in src/clysm/stage1/runner.lisp to invoke wasmtime via host shim
    66â†’- [ ] T018 [US1] Extend host-shim/stage1-host.js with --mode compile support
    67â†’- [ ] T019 [US1] Implement compileToStage2() function in host-shim/stage1-host.js
    68â†’- [ ] T020 [US1] Create src/clysm/stage2/generator.lisp with generate-stage2 function
    69â†’- [ ] T021 [US1] Implement module reading and compilation orchestration in src/clysm/stage2/generator.lisp
    70â†’- [ ] T022 [US1] Handle partial compilation failure (FR-010) in src/clysm/stage2/generator.lisp
    71â†’- [ ] T023 [US1] Create build/stage2-gen.lisp CLI entry point
    72â†’- [ ] T024 [US1] Create scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh shell wrapper
    73â†’
    74â†’**Checkpoint**: Stage 2 generation works - `./scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh` produces valid Wasm binary
    75â†’
    76â†’---
    77â†’
    78â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Fixed-Point Verification (Priority: P1)
    79â†’
    80â†’**Goal**: Compare Stage 1 and Stage 2 byte-by-byte to verify identical match (fixed-point)
    81â†’
    82â†’**Independent Test**: Run binary comparison on two files and verify correct identical/different status
    83â†’
    84â†’### Tests for User Story 2
    85â†’
    86â†’- [ ] T025 [P] [US2] Unit test for binaries-identical-p in tests/unit/fixpoint/byte-compare-test.lisp
    87â†’- [ ] T026 [P] [US2] Unit test for verify-fixpoint in tests/unit/fixpoint/verifier-test.lisp
    88â†’- [ ] T027 [P] [US2] Integration test for full verification in tests/integration/fixpoint-verify-test.lisp
    89â†’
    90â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
    91â†’
    92â†’- [ ] T028 [US2] Implement binaries-identical-p in src/clysm/stage1/diff.lisp
    93â†’- [ ] T029 [US2] Return first-diff-offset from binaries-identical-p in src/clysm/stage1/diff.lisp
    94â†’- [ ] T030 [US2] Create src/clysm/stage1/fixpoint.lisp with fixpoint-status type
    95â†’- [ ] T031 [US2] Implement status-to-exit-code mapping in src/clysm/stage1/fixpoint.lisp
    96â†’- [ ] T032 [US2] Create src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp with verify-fixpoint function
    97â†’- [ ] T033 [US2] Implement dependency checking (wasmtime, Stage 1) in src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp
    98â†’- [ ] T034 [US2] Implement Stage 1 validation (FR-008) using wasm-tools in src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp
    99â†’- [ ] T035 [US2] Integrate Stage 2 generation + comparison in src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp
   100â†’- [ ] T036 [US2] Output human-readable result (ACHIEVED/NOT ACHIEVED) in src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp
   101â†’
   102â†’**Checkpoint**: `(clysm/stage2:verify-fixpoint)` returns correct verification-result struct
   103â†’
   104â†’---
   105â†’
   106â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Diff Analysis Report (Priority: P2)
   107â†’
   108â†’**Goal**: Generate detailed diff report showing byte offsets, section mismatches, export differences
   109â†’
   110â†’**Independent Test**: Create two different Wasm files and verify report identifies differences correctly
   111â†’
   112â†’### Tests for User Story 3
   113â†’
   114â†’- [ ] T037 [P] [US3] Unit test for byte-diff-info generation in tests/unit/fixpoint/byte-diff-test.lisp
   115â†’- [ ] T038 [P] [US3] Unit test for section-level diff in tests/unit/fixpoint/section-diff-test.lisp
   116â†’- [ ] T039 [P] [US3] Contract test for diff report format in tests/contract/fixpoint-diff-test.lisp
   117â†’
   118â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   119â†’
   120â†’- [ ] T040 [US3] Extend src/clysm/stage1/diff.lisp with generate-byte-diff-report function
   121â†’- [ ] T041 [US3] Implement total-diff-bytes calculation in src/clysm/stage1/diff.lisp
   122â†’- [ ] T042 [US3] Implement size-mismatch detection in src/clysm/stage1/diff.lisp
   123â†’- [ ] T043 [US3] Extend export comparison in src/clysm/stage1/diff.lisp for added/removed/modified
   124â†’- [ ] T044 [US3] Extend type comparison in src/clysm/stage1/diff.lisp for signature differences
   125â†’- [ ] T045 [US3] Extend scripts/diff-stages.sh with --byte-level option
   126â†’
   127â†’**Checkpoint**: `./scripts/diff-stages.sh --byte-level` shows detailed byte/section diff
   128â†’
   129â†’---
   130â†’
   131â†’## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Automated CI Verification (Priority: P2)
   132â†’
   133â†’**Goal**: CI pipeline integration with exit codes and JSON output
   134â†’
   135â†’**Independent Test**: Run verification script and verify exit code matches status (0/1/2/3)
   136â†’
   137â†’### Tests for User Story 4
   138â†’
   139â†’- [ ] T046 [P] [US4] Unit test for JSON output format in tests/unit/fixpoint/json-output-test.lisp
   140â†’- [ ] T047 [P] [US4] Integration test for exit codes in tests/integration/fixpoint-exitcode-test.lisp
   141â†’
   142â†’### Implementation for User Story 4
   143â†’
   144â†’- [ ] T048 [US4] Implement JSON output (FR-006) in src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp
   145â†’- [ ] T049 [US4] Add output-format parameter (:text/:json) to verify-fixpoint in src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp
   146â†’- [ ] T050 [US4] Implement timing capture (stage2-gen-time-ms, comparison-time-ms) in src/clysm/stage2/verifier.lisp
   147â†’- [ ] T051 [US4] Create scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh main verification script
   148â†’- [ ] T052 [US4] Implement --json option in scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh
   149â†’- [ ] T053 [US4] Implement --skip-generate option in scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh
   150â†’- [ ] T054 [US4] Implement exit code mapping (FR-007: 0/1/2/3) in scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh
   151â†’- [ ] T055 [US4] Add --help option with usage information in scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh
   152â†’
   153â†’**Checkpoint**: `./scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh --json` returns proper JSON and exit code
   154â†’
   155â†’---
   156â†’
   157â†’## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Iterative Improvement Tracking (Priority: P3)
   158â†’
   159â†’**Goal**: Track verification history across iterations to show progress toward fixed-point
   160â†’
   161â†’**Independent Test**: Run verification multiple times and verify history log is appended
   162â†’
   163â†’### Tests for User Story 5
   164â†’
   165â†’- [ ] T056 [P] [US5] Unit test for history entry append in tests/unit/fixpoint/history-test.lisp
   166â†’- [ ] T057 [P] [US5] Unit test for progress summary in tests/unit/fixpoint/progress-test.lisp
   167â†’
   168â†’### Implementation for User Story 5
   169â†’
   170â†’- [ ] T058 [US5] Implement append-to-history in src/clysm/stage1/fixpoint.lisp
   171â†’- [ ] T059 [US5] Implement JSON Lines format for dist/verification-history.jsonl
   172â†’- [ ] T060 [US5] Implement read-history-log in src/clysm/stage1/fixpoint.lisp
   173â†’- [ ] T061 [US5] Implement compute-progress-summary in src/clysm/stage1/fixpoint.lisp
   174â†’- [ ] T062 [US5] Add --history option to scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh
   175â†’- [ ] T063 [US5] Implement trend detection (improving/regressing) in src/clysm/stage1/fixpoint.lisp
   176â†’
   177â†’**Checkpoint**: `./scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh --history` appends to log; history can be queried
   178â†’
   179â†’---
   180â†’
   181â†’## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   182â†’
   183â†’**Purpose**: Documentation, cleanup, and cross-story improvements
   184â†’
   185â†’- [ ] T064 [P] Update quickstart.md with actual command outputs
   186â†’- [ ] T065 [P] Add docstrings to all new functions in src/clysm/stage1/*.lisp
   187â†’- [ ] T066 [P] Add docstrings to all new functions in src/clysm/stage2/*.lisp
   188â†’- [ ] T067 Run all unit tests and ensure pass
   189â†’- [ ] T068 Run all contract tests and ensure pass
   190â†’- [ ] T069 Run all integration tests and ensure pass
   191â†’- [ ] T070 Validate scripts work in nix develop environment
   192â†’- [ ] T071 Update CLAUDE.md with Feature 040 summary
   193â†’
   194â†’---
   195â†’
   196â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   197â†’
   198â†’### Phase Dependencies
   199â†’
   200â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   201â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
   202â†’- **User Story 1 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - ğŸ¯ MVP target
   203â†’- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Foundational AND User Story 1 (needs Stage 2 generation)
   204â†’- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Foundational - Can run parallel to US1/US2
   205â†’- **User Story 4 (Phase 6)**: Depends on US1 + US2 (needs full verification workflow)
   206â†’- **User Story 5 (Phase 7)**: Depends on US4 (needs verification results to track)
   207â†’- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete
   208â†’
   209â†’### User Story Dependencies
   210â†’
   211â†’```
   212â†’                    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   213â†’                    â”‚    Setup      â”‚
   214â†’                    â”‚   (Phase 1)   â”‚
   215â†’                    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   216â†’                            â”‚
   217â†’                            â–¼
   218â†’                    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   219â†’                    â”‚  Foundational â”‚
   220â†’                    â”‚   (Phase 2)   â”‚
   221â†’                    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   222â†’                            â”‚
   223â†’            â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   224â†’            â”‚               â”‚               â”‚

   227â†’    â”‚ US1: Stage 2  â”‚ â”‚ US3: Diff â”‚ â”‚  (other)  â”‚
   228â†’    â”‚   Generation  â”‚ â”‚  Report   â”‚ â”‚           â”‚
   229â†’    â”‚   (Phase 3)   â”‚ â”‚ (Phase 5) â”‚ â”‚           â”‚
   230â†’    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   231â†’            â”‚
   232â†’            â–¼
   233â†’    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   234â†’    â”‚ US2: Fixed-   â”‚
   235â†’    â”‚ Point Verify  â”‚
   236â†’    â”‚   (Phase 4)   â”‚
   237â†’    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   238â†’            â”‚
   239â†’            â–¼
   240â†’    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   241â†’    â”‚ US4: CI       â”‚
   242â†’    â”‚ Integration   â”‚
   243â†’    â”‚   (Phase 6)   â”‚
   244â†’    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   245â†’            â”‚
   246â†’            â–¼
   247â†’    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   248â†’    â”‚ US5: History  â”‚
   249â†’    â”‚   Tracking    â”‚
   250â†’    â”‚   (Phase 7)   â”‚
   251â†’    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   252â†’```
   253â†’
   254â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   255â†’
   256â†’**Within Phase 1 (Setup)**:
   257â†’- T002, T003, T004 can run in parallel
   258â†’- T005, T006, T007 can run in parallel
   259â†’
   260â†’**Within Phase 2 (Foundational)**:
   261â†’- T008, T009, T010 can run in parallel (same file but different structs)
   262â†’- T011, T012, T013 depend on T008-T010
   263â†’
   264â†’**Within User Stories**:
   265â†’- All [P] marked tests can run in parallel
   266â†’- Implementation tasks typically sequential within each story
   267â†’
   268â†’**Across User Stories**:
   269â†’- US3 (Diff Report) can start in parallel with US1/US2 after Foundational
   270â†’- US1 and US3 have no interdependency
   271â†’
   272â†’---
   273â†’
   274â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 1
   275â†’
   276â†’```bash
   277â†’# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together:
   278â†’Task: "Unit test for wasmtime invocation in tests/unit/fixpoint/runner-test.lisp"
   279â†’Task: "Unit test for Stage 2 generation in tests/unit/fixpoint/stage2-gen-test.lisp"
   280â†’Task: "Contract test for Stage 2 binary validity in tests/contract/fixpoint-stage2-test.lisp"
   281â†’```
   282â†’
   283â†’---
   284â†’
   285â†’## Implementation Strategy
   286â†’
   287â†’### MVP First (User Story 1 + 2 Only)
   288â†’
   289â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (verify prerequisites)
   290â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
   291â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (Stage 2 Generation)
   292â†’4. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (Fixed-Point Verification)
   293â†’5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Run `(clysm/stage2:verify-fixpoint)` manually
   294â†’6. Deploy/demo if verification works
   295â†’
   296â†’### Incremental Delivery
   297â†’
   298â†’1. Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
   299â†’2. Add User Story 1 â†’ Test with `./scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh` â†’ Can produce Stage 2
   300â†’3. Add User Story 2 â†’ Test manually in REPL â†’ Can verify fixed-point
   301â†’4. Add User Story 4 â†’ `./scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh` works â†’ CI-ready
   302â†’5. Add User Story 3 â†’ Detailed diff reports available
   303â†’6. Add User Story 5 â†’ Progress tracking enabled
   304â†’
   305â†’### Recommended Execution Order
   306â†’
   307â†’1. **T001-T013**: Setup + Foundational (must be sequential mostly)
   308â†’2. **T014-T024**: US1 tests + implementation (Stage 2 gen)
   309â†’3. **T025-T036**: US2 tests + implementation (verification)
   310â†’4. **T046-T055**: US4 tests + implementation (CI script)
   311â†’5. **T037-T045**: US3 tests + implementation (diff report)
   312â†’6. **T056-T063**: US5 tests + implementation (history)
   313â†’7. **T064-T071**: Polish
   314â†’
   315â†’---
   316â†’
   317â†’## Notes
   318â†’
   319â†’- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   320â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   321â†’- Constitution requires TDD - write tests first, verify they fail
   322â†’- FR-007 exit codes: 0 (achieved), 1 (not achieved), 2 (compile error), 3 (missing dep)
   323â†’- FR-008 requires wasm-tools validation before Stage 1 execution
   324â†’- FR-010 requires graceful handling of partial compilation failure
   325â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   326â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
   327â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Fixed-Point Verification (Phase 13B)

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/040-fixed-point-verification/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: Included per Constitution Principle VII (TDD required)

**Organization**: Tasks grouped by user story for independent implementation and testing

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (US1, US2, US3, US4, US5)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Project initialization and prerequisite verification

- [ ] T001 Verify Stage 1 binary exists at dist/clysm-stage1.wasm
- [ ] T002 Verify wasmtime runtime is available (wasmtime --version)
- [ ] T003 [P] Verify wasm-tools is available (wasm-tools --version)
- [ ] T004 [P] Verify Node.js is available for host shims (node --version)
- [ ] T005 Create tests/unit/fixpoint/ directory structure
- [ ] T006 [P] Create tests/contract/ fixpoint test placeholder
- [ ] T007 [P] Create tests/integration/ fixpoint test placeholder

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core data structures and package definitions that ALL user stories depend on

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [ ] T008 Extend src/clysm/stage1/types.lisp with verification-result struct
- [ ] T009 [P] Extend src/clysm/stage1/types.lisp with byte-diff-info struct
- [ ] T010 [P] Extend src/clysm/stage1/types.lisp with verification-history-entry struct
- [ ] T011 Extend src/clysm/stage1/conditions.lisp with fixpoint-error condition hierarchy
- [ ] T012 Create src/clysm/stage2/package.lisp with clysm/stage2 package definition
- [ ] T013 Export new symbols from src/clysm/stage1/package.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Stage 2 Generation (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Run Stage 1 Wasm binary on wasmtime to compile Clysm source and produce Stage 2 binary

**Independent Test**: Execute `./scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh` and verify `dist/clysm-stage2.wasm` is created and valid

### Tests for User Story 1

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Unit test for wasmtime invocation in tests/unit/fixpoint/runner-test.lisp
- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Unit test for Stage 2 generation in tests/unit/fixpoint/stage2-gen-test.lisp

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Story 1 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - ğŸ¯ MVP target
- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Foundational AND User Story 1 (needs Stage 2 generation)
- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Foundational - Can run parallel to US1/US2
- **User Story 4 (Phase 6)**: Depends on US1 + US2 (needs full verification workflow)
- **User Story 5 (Phase 7)**: Depends on US4 (needs verification results to track)
- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete

### User Story Dependencies

### Parallel Opportunities

**Within Phase 1 (Setup)**:
- T002, T003, T004 can run in parallel
- T005, T006, T007 can run in parallel

**Within Phase 2 (Foundational)**:
- T008, T009, T010 can run in parallel (same file but different structs)
- T011, T012, T013 depend on T008-T010

**Within User Stories**:
- All [P] marked tests can run in parallel
- Implementation tasks typically sequential within each story

**Across User Stories**:
- US3 (Diff Report) can start in parallel with US1/US2 after Foundational
- US1 and US3 have no interdependency

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1

```bash
# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together:
Task: "Unit test for wasmtime invocation in tests/unit/fixpoint/runner-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for Stage 2 generation in tests/unit/fixpoint/stage2-gen-test.lisp"
Task: "Contract test for Stage 2 binary validity in tests/contract/fixpoint-stage2-test.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 + 2 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (verify prerequisites)
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (Stage 2 Generation)
4. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (Fixed-Point Verification)
5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Run `(clysm/stage2:verify-fixpoint)` manually
6. Deploy/demo if verification works

### Incremental Delivery

1. Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
2. Add User Story 1 â†’ Test with `./scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh` â†’ Can produce Stage 2
3. Add User Story 2 â†’ Test manually in REPL â†’ Can verify fixed-point
4. Add User Story 4 â†’ `./scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh` works â†’ CI-ready
5. Add User Story 3 â†’ Detailed diff reports available
6. Add User Story 5 â†’ Progress tracking enabled

### Recommended Execution Order

1. **T001-T013**: Setup + Foundational (must be sequential mostly)
2. **T014-T024**: US1 tests + implementation (Stage 2 gen)
3. **T025-T036**: US2 tests + implementation (verification)
4. **T046-T055**: US4 tests + implementation (CI script)
5. **T037-T045**: US3 tests + implementation (diff report)
6. **T056-T063**: US5 tests + implementation (history)
7. **T064-T071**: Polish

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- Constitution requires TDD - write tests first, verify they fail
- FR-007 exit codes: 0 (achieved), 1 (not achieved), 2 (compile error), 3 (missing dep)
- FR-008 requires wasm-tools validation before Stage 1 execution
- FR-010 requires graceful handling of partial compilation failure
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
